posts.name: Mentor
posts.cooked:
Team 4533 created simplified field elements in Onshape: Speaker, Amp, Source & Stage.

Please use as you see fit, but verify all critical dimensions!

Sign in to Onshape, the #1 fastest growing CAD system in the world with over 4 million users.

Field Elements Simple 2024 951×447 83.5 KB b094bc2c95344c0ff2f8d

Field Elements Simple 2024 951×447 83.5 KB

Field Elements Simple 2024 951×447 83.5 KB

posts.name: Phil Szymanowski
posts.cooked:
This is awesome! I’m sure many teams have made similar things, but thank you for sharing!

Right now I only see the amp available: image 382×636 18.8 KB

image 382×636 18.8 KB

image 382×636 18.8 KB

You may need to make another version that has the rest of the elements in it.

posts.name: Mentor
posts.cooked:
That’s strange. My document shows all 4 field elements, finished about 11:00 am Sunday morning. I added the Note Sunday night.

Another team said they see all 4 elements. Do you still only see the Amp?

posts.name: John Hascall (he)
posts.cooked: Kind of wondering if the stage will fall over w/o a 3rd leg…

posts.name: Mentor
posts.cooked: Humans say upright with only two legs. Most of the time…

posts.name: John Hascall (he)
posts.cooked: Maybe harder with a big booty hanging out back like that though…

posts.name: Phil Szymanowski
posts.cooked:
That’s on the main version, which is the active working one. The one everyone has access to is version 1, which only has the amp.

You need to make a new version for everyone to get the updated ones.

image 1658×831 110 KB

image 1658×831 110 KB

posts.name: Mentor
posts.cooked:
Thank you Phil!  I’m somewhat new to Onshape.

Can you see all 4 elements now?

LINK

posts.name: Phil Szymanowski
posts.cooked:
Yep! I can get them now.

Thanks again for this!

posts.name: CEF
posts.cooked: On the stage, you really want more bracing on the two support legs.  The robot’s weight is going to put a lot of force on those supports, and they will tend to bend inward.   Here’s what the “official” elements do for this.

posts.name: Roger Moore
posts.cooked:
These seem to be intended for use in CAD only.

(If you’re really concerned the entire structure would tip backwards since it’s missing the other leg )

posts.name: Mentor
posts.cooked:
Yes - these are intended for CAD only, to help design your robot.

Each element is only one-piece. I don’t know how you would fabricate them, unless you had a 3D printer with an 8’ tall print capability!

suggested_topics.title: New Featurescript: ball trajectory calculator
suggested_topics.excerpt: I made a ball trajectory calculator as a Featurescript in Onshape. It includes drag and backspin (though they are usually negligible).
